text: 750ml bottle, thanks Jonathan G. Aroma: vineous nose, cheese, oak, lots of blackberries, cherries, lots of funk similar to a lambic. App: dark red with orange tint, minimal off light pink head leaving good lacing considering the size of this head. Taste and palate: medium body, moderate high carbonation, light sweetness, tart, moderate acidity, salty and really dry finish. Overall: quite interesting beer. Lots of funk, lots of fruits, dryness and tartness. Wonder if I should have aged it since there are some similarities with some Cantillon. Good stuff.

Poured at the brewery. Pours a deep rose/red, deep pink head. Aroma is berries, tart lemon, barnyard, light horse blanket, lacto, plum, oak. Flavor is very tart berries, cherry, lacto, very tart on the back end. Medium bodied, very acidic and sour berries.

Bottle thanks to @@ron! Shite,I didnt realize this was such an esteemed beer when I opened it! My wife thought it was so so, for what its worth. I enjoyed the very hazy reddish pour, light off-white head and decent lacing. The aroma is a great mix of blackberries and lactic slightly cheesy funk. Flavor is light plus tart, blackberries, medium funk with a horseblanket note that reminds one of lambic in addition to a certain cheesiness. Some tannins from the barrels as well. Medium body, soft mouthfeel. Enjoyable.

pours dark pink with a small head. Aroma has loads of brett, cellar notes, wet cobwebs, hint of earth, juicy blackberries, aroma is lambic cantillon like. Sour up front, dry with wet blackberries, very tart with balanced funk. Along with the very best sours I have sampled

750 mL bottle. Pink body. Medium white head. Smells of berries and strong acidity. A hint of rubber. Tastes of strong blackberry. Pretty sour. A little yogurt. Oak. Less rubber, but its still there. Well carbonated. Its not bad.

From notes. Bottle shared with ebone1988, Gus, and Aaron at Gus Birthday V2. 750 mL bottle. The pour is a bright pink/purple color with a tiny ring of light pink head that vanishes in an instant. The aroma is hugely sour. Holy shit. My mouth waters and clenches at the aroma. The blackberry is fantastic. There is a beautiful funk. The light barnyard balances out a little dustiness and this just is wonderful. Sour, tart, and fruity. The flavor is just as good. The fruit is heavy, and the tartness is just fantastic. The mouth-watering ability of this beer are delightful. Light funk and fruit really go with the resounding sour. The mouth feel is light, crisp, clean with a bright carbonation and a heavy sour blackberry on the finish. Fuck, is this a fantastic beer.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, Gus, and Aaron for Gus Birthday Part 2. Aroma is funk, barnyard, super sour, blackberries, lacto, amazing. Appearance is ruby red, off white head, hazy. Taste is super tart, sour, blackberries, funk, so sour, so good. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, sour funky blackberries aftertaste. Overall, its really really good.
Bottle. Dark amber pour with a white head. Sweet berry bouquet. Big sour berry notes. Oak and caramel. A bit one dimensional but still a good body and mouthfeel.
Bottle: Poured pink with white head. Aroma is sour berry tart. Taste is nice funky tart, carbonation.

10 oz pour at Falling Rock Tap House. Hazy, bright, reddish appearance with a small white head. Aroma of blackberries, oak, sour funk and a bit of earthiness. Similar flavor, medium to heavy sourness with a mild fruity sweetness. Light to medium body with a tart, puckering feel and a lingering acidic finish. Fresh, fruity, sour and delicious overall.

750, corked and baled. Thanks, C! I seriously have trouble explaining how much I appreciate this. Such an incredible treat I didnt think Id get my hands on anytime soon. Pours a crystal clear medium pinkish purple, more on the purple side. Bright piercing acidic berry nose, intense juicy sour berries and sharp lemon zest, balanced with berry sweetness and some light malt sweetness; overall very cohesive and incredibly inviting. Creamy medium body with minimal carb but a pleasant acidic bite to it. Sharp berry sourness, lemon zest, lightly sweetened cereal under that. Long tangy sweet sharp finish.

Bottle pour at the source. Gorgeous, ruby, pink head; some lacing. Big fruit nose; funk, tart almost unripe berries. Taste is hugely acidic, tart. Some blanket and funk. Lasting puckering tart finish. Light body, good carbonation. A little metallic at end. Sweetens and mellows in the glass as it warms.

B2 fresh. Cloudy light purple with pink head. Nose is tart and ripe blackberries, light yogurt, on the funky mineral, light lemon Oak Theory base. Taste is nice balance between the sour base and tart, tannic blackberries, and a sensation of sweetness from the fruit. Seedy, brambly blackberries.
Light red with a pink tinged head. Sour up front, lactic sourness, tart blackberry, lemons, barnyard funk. Nice.
Bottle thanks to Russell. Pours a hazy pink/purple with small off white head that lasts. The aroma is strong funk, oak, berry, lemon. Thin mouth, tart berry, funk, lemon, oak, very nice.

Bottle care of Jean with Frank and I, pours slightly hazy reddish plum color with light off white head. Aroma and flavor are sour blackberry, firm blueberry skin, lemon, boysenberry and oak. Lighter to medium body. Shes pretty sour but has just the right amount of acid before becoming unbearable like Jester King, bruery, and certain de garde offerings. Solid yo
Smell is sour blackberry. Taste is the same with a nice tart blackberry aftertaste. Medium body, medium carbonation, and virtually no foam.

Bottle. Pours a deep pink with orangey hues and white head. Aroma is very brambly, blackberry, wild yeasts, hint of oakiness, citrus. Taste is med sour, good funk to it, nice blackberry flavor with not going overboard. Overall, very good.

Bottle @ Aarons Wedding Eve Shindig. Thanks, @@. Hazed reddish-purple pour with some khaki head. Really nice blackberry aroma. Pie filling, some grass, and a nice bit of lemon zest. A light vinous quality to the flavor along with some tangy berry and a touch of jammy sweetness. Good acidity, some citrus zest, and a nice dry/tannic note to the finish. Nice beer.

Bottle shared at my pre-wedding bash with some other RB nerds. Pours a hazy, purplish appearance with a light brown head. The aroma is similar to Oak Theory with some lemon, lactic acid, funk, cheese, and oak. Along with that, theres plenty of berries that arent overly powerful. The flavor again has Oak Theory forefront with complementary berries. Slight tannins / slightly seedy. Not burningly sour. Plenty of oak. Really enjoyable. Again, the fruit doesnt completely dominate the flavor which is a breath of fresh air. One of the better fruit beers Ive had in a while. I preferred this one to the Balaton Cherry Cut slightly but both were fantastic. Very good.
Bottle shared by adnielsen and lenincat. Thanks dudes! Pours a reddish color with white head. Blackberry, berry, boysenberry aromas. Sour, blackberry, raspberry flavors.

Bottle at the Niels pre wedding bash. Pinkish pour, pretty hazy with a small white head. Similar to the cherry in that you can taste the fruit skins but it isnt astringent like chewing on s grape skin. Moderately fruit forward in comparison to other sours but these Casey folks are striking a great balance in fruit and funkiness. Moderate barny and almost cheese like. Still has a moderate lemon and wood character similar to oak theory. Dang good.

Bottle at Aarons Pre-Wedding Bash. Pour is hazy pink with a small white head and decent lacing. Funky, cheesy, biscuit, bready, some urine, fruit skins, and blackberries in the aroma. Taste is big sour fruits, blackberry skins, raspberries, tangy, lots of oak, lemon and biscuit with a huge sour finish. Light body with medium carbonation. Tasty, but not what I expected.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs; thanks @@ron). Bottled 2/17/15. Looks Smells and tastes tart, oaky, and funky with a great blackberry presence. Mouthfeel is medium-light to medium-bodied and pleasantly tart and lively. Another fantastic fruited varietal of Oak Theory.

Bottle thanks to the cool [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ in CO ! Purrs a ripe hazy mauve with a finger plus of gaseous white foam. Musty blackberry nose with nuances of wet grain, foggy dew soaked oak, vanilla. Palate follows with nice tannic blackberry notes that enhance the soft foggy grain, wet barrel funk and delicious complexity of yeast that Casey has been nailing ! Delicious.

750ml bottle shared big thanks to Lukeduke! Pours hazy red violet with small head. Nose is soft berry funk, some dusty hay, light oak, balanced acidity, some cheerio grain. Taste is similar with great balance throughout, tart blackberry and grape, not super jammy, crisp acidity, some musty oak, dry hay and grain. Finishes with a touch of berry sweetness, earthy soft funk, dry grain. Really good but for my tastes Blackberry fruitstand was a hair better.

From short notes...

Fun pink/purple pour with low head. Nice nose with red pepper, yeasty tones, fresh sour unripe berries. Light medium body. Taste is weak berries and lemon juice. Not nearly as jammy as I'd like. 4

Glass from Bottle @ Release. Dark red pour with a light tan lacing. Almost blood red and opaque. Really deep nose of blackberry and a brett farmhouse funk.. This glass has a juicy berry flavor that goes on for ages. Finishes extremely clean and dry. God damn this is amazing.
